intro: Sphaeritis ciliata, commonly known as the silky sphaeritis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Native to parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in woodland areas. Its unique morphology and ecological preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
